TargetName: SOW-036: Formalize a deliverable-level lock mechanism for concurrent task execution
Statement: DEL-08-05 implements scope item SOW-036 which covers formalizing a deliverable-level lock mechanism for concurrent task execution.
Notes: FACT. Confirmed in Decomposition Scope Ledger: SOW-036 -> PKG-08 -> DEL-08-05.

Statement: DEL-08-05 supports OBJ-007 (Optional: integrity hardening loop) via PKG-08 package grouping.
EvidenceQuote: Supports Objectives: OBJ-007 -- ASSUMPTION (best-effort mapping via PKG-08 package grouping)
Notes: ASSUMPTION. Best-effort mapping via PKG-08 grouping; human confirmation needed (Lensing C-001). Confirmed in Decomposition: SOW-036 -> OBJ-007.

Statement: Lock mechanism must respect agent write-scope boundaries; lock file placement must comply with deliverable-local write scope.
EvidenceQuote: The lock mechanism MUST NOT require any agent to write outside its declared write scope (K-WRITE-1).
Notes: FACT. Explicit traceability in Specification REQ-LOCK-008 and Datasheet Conditions.

Statement: Lock state must be independent of _STATUS.md lifecycle state (lifecycle orthogonality).
EvidenceQuote: Lock state MUST be independent of _STATUS.md lifecycle state.
Notes: FACT. Explicit traceability in Specification REQ-LOCK-009 and Datasheet Conditions.

Statement: Lock file must not introduce information that agents treat as execution context beyond concurrency control.
EvidenceQuote: The lock file MUST NOT introduce information that agents treat as execution context beyond the lock's concurrency-control purpose.
Notes: FACT. Explicit traceability in Specification REQ-LOCK-010.

Statement: SOW-036 is TBD; deliverable cannot proceed to full implementation until scope is flipped IN by human decision (OI-036).
EvidenceQuote: scaffold pending SOW-036 IN decision (OI-036). This deliverable cannot proceed to full implementation until scope is flipped IN.
Notes: FACT. Explicit gate: OI-036 resolution required before full implementation. Also confirmed in Specification Precondition and Procedure Part A Step 1.

Statement: Lock mechanism intent and requirements originate from PLAN Section 3.5 (lock mechanism intent and effort estimate and sequencing position).
EvidenceQuote: docs/PLAN.md Section 3.5: Lock mechanism intent, effort estimate, and sequencing position
Notes: FACT. Primary source of lock mechanism requirements and design intent.

Statement: Lock mechanism must comply with CONTRACT.md invariants (K-WRITE-1 K-STATUS-1 K-GHOST-1 K-SEAL-1) governing write scope and lifecycle state.
EvidenceQuote: docs/CONTRACT.md: Invariants governing write scope (K-WRITE-1), status (K-STATUS-1), sealed context (K-SEAL-1), no ghost inputs (K-GHOST-1)
Notes: FACT. Multiple invariants from CONTRACT.md are binding constraints on lock mechanism design.

Statement: Filesystem-is-database constraint and no external DB requirement are binding constraints on lock implementation.
EvidenceQuote: Lock must use filesystem only; no external services or databases (DIRECTIVE Section 5)
Notes: FACT. Explicit constraint from DIRECTIVE governing lock state storage mechanism.

Statement: Lock file placement must be consistent with deliverable folder layout (Section 2) and lock must not conflict with _STATUS.md lifecycle (Section 3).
EvidenceQuote: docs/SPEC.md Section 2: Deliverable folder layout; Section 3: _STATUS.md lifecycle
Notes: FACT. SPEC defines folder layout and lifecycle rules that constrain lock file placement and behavior.

Statement: Agent type model defines Type 2 task agents as the concurrency unit for locks.
EvidenceQuote: docs/TYPES.md Section 4: Agent type model (lock holders are Type 2 task agents)
Notes: FACT. Lock mechanism targets Type 2 task agents as defined in TYPES.md.

Statement: Platform constraint: lock mechanism must function on macOS 15+ Apple Silicon (the sole target platform).
EvidenceQuote: The lock mechanism MUST function correctly on macOS 15+ / Apple Silicon (the sole target platform).
Notes: FACT. Confirmed in Decomposition Decision Log DEC-PLAT-001. Platform constraint is binding on implementation choices (e.g. APFS atomicity).

TargetName: DEL-08-06: Unified Pipeline Run Record Persistence
Statement: Subsequent deliverables (run records DEL-08-06) may need lock awareness per sequencing position.
EvidenceQuote: subsequent deliverables (run records DEL-08-06, staleness DEL-08-07) may need lock awareness
Notes: ASSUMPTION. Guidance C5 states downstream deliverables may need lock awareness; degree of coupling is TBD pending those deliverables' scope decisions.

Statement: Subsequent deliverables (staleness DEL-08-07) may need lock awareness per sequencing position.
EvidenceQuote: subsequent deliverables (run records DEL-08-06, staleness DEL-08-07) may need lock awareness
Notes: ASSUMPTION. Guidance C5 states downstream deliverables may need lock awareness; degree of coupling is TBD pending those deliverables' scope decisions.

Statement: Task agent (Type 2) instruction protocols must be modified to integrate lock acquire/release per REQ-LOCK-007.
EvidenceQuote: Task agent (Type 2) protocols MUST be updated to: 1. Attempt lock acquisition before writing to a deliverable folder.
Notes: ASSUMPTION. REQ-LOCK-007 requires agent protocol updates; DEL-06-02 covers local deliverable workflow agents. Exact integration surface TBD.
